tasks.title: Setup Project Repository
tasks.description: Initialize a new Django project and repository for DRIS, including basic project structure and version control.
tasks.details: Create a new Django project named DRIS_Project. Set up a Git repository, add a README.md, and initialize a virtual environment. Install Django, Django-admin, and Bootstrap dependencies. Configure basic settings.py and urls.py.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify project creation by running the Django development server and accessing the default welcome page. Check repository structure and dependency installation.

subtasks.title: Initialize Git Repository and Create README
subtasks.description: Set up a new Git repository for the DRIS project and add a README.md file with basic project information.
subtasks.details: Create a new directory for the project. Run 'git init' to initialize version control. Add a README.md file describing the project purpose, setup instructions, and any relevant metadata. Make the initial commit to establish the repository baseline.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that 'git status' shows a clean working directory and that README.md is tracked in the repository.

subtasks.title: Set Up Python Virtual Environment
subtasks.description: Create and activate a Python virtual environment to isolate project dependencies.
subtasks.details: Use 'python -m venv venv' (or preferred tool) to create a virtual environment inside the project directory. Activate the environment according to the OS (e.g., 'source venv/bin/activate' for Unix or 'venv\Scripts\activate' for Windows).
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that the Python interpreter points to the virtual environment and that 'which python' or 'where python' reflects the correct path.

subtasks.title: Install Django and Required Dependencies
subtasks.description: Install Django, Django-admin, and Bootstrap (or related frontend dependencies) within the virtual environment.
subtasks.details: Run 'pip install django' and any other required packages (e.g., 'pip install django-admin'). For Bootstrap, either install via npm/yarn if using a frontend build process, or plan to include Bootstrap via CDN in templates. Add installed packages to requirements.txt using 'pip freeze > requirements.txt'.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'python -m django --version' to confirm Django is installed. Check that requirements.txt lists all dependencies.

subtasks.title: Create Django Project Structure
subtasks.description: Initialize a new Django project named DRIS_Project and establish the recommended directory structure.
subtasks.details: Run 'django-admin startproject DRIS_Project .' to create the project in the current directory. Follow best practices by organizing the project root, separating apps, static, and media directories as needed. Consider creating an 'apps' directory for modular app development, as recommended for scalable Django projects[2][4].
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that manage.py and the DRIS_Project directory are present. Ensure the structure matches Django conventions and any additional folders (e.g., apps, static, media) are created.

subtasks.title: Configure Basic settings.py and urls.py
subtasks.description: Edit settings.py and urls.py to set up initial configurations, including installed apps, static files, and Bootstrap integration.
subtasks.details: Open DRIS_Project/settings.py and configure INSTALLED_APPS, STATIC_URL, and other basic settings. Set up urls.py with a root URL pattern. If using Bootstrap via CDN, prepare a base template that includes the Bootstrap stylesheet link. Commit all changes to the repository.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'python manage.py runserver' to ensure the project starts without errors. Access the root URL to confirm the configuration is functional.

tasks.title: Define Data Model
tasks.description: Design and document the database schema, entities, and relationships as per PRD requirements.
tasks.details: Create Data_Model.md in /docs. Define models for User (with role: Citizen, Volunteer, Authority), DisasterReport (type, GPS, severity, timestamp), AidRequest (type, status), Volunteer (skills, availability), Shelter (location, capacity, availability). Use Django models for ORM. Plan relationships and constraints.
tasks.testStrategy: Review Data_Model.md for completeness. Validate model relationships and fields against PRD requirements.

subtasks.title: Analyze PRD and Gather Requirements
subtasks.description: Review the Product Requirements Document (PRD) to extract all necessary data entities, attributes, and relationships required for the data model.
subtasks.details: Carefully read through the PRD and any related documentation. List out all entities (User, DisasterReport, AidRequest, Volunteer, Shelter) and their required fields. Identify business rules, constraints, and relationships between entities. Document findings as a reference for the next steps.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that all entities and attributes mentioned in the PRD are captured in the requirements list.

subtasks.title: Design Entity-Relationship Diagram (ERD)
subtasks.description: Create an Entity-Relationship Diagram to visually map out entities, their attributes, and relationships based on the requirements.
subtasks.details: Use diagramming tools (e.g., draw.io, Lucidchart) to create an ERD. Clearly define primary keys, foreign keys, and cardinality for each relationship. Ensure all entities (User, DisasterReport, AidRequest, Volunteer, Shelter) and their connections are represented. Review for normalization and avoid redundancy.
subtasks.testStrategy: Cross-check the ERD with the requirements list to ensure completeness and accuracy.

subtasks.title: Define Django ORM Models
subtasks.description: Translate the ERD into Django model classes, specifying fields, relationships, and constraints for each entity.
subtasks.details: Implement Django models for each entity in a models.py file. Use appropriate field types, define relationships (ForeignKey, ManyToMany, OneToOne), and set constraints (unique, nullability). Include model docstrings to describe each model’s purpose and fields.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run Django's makemigrations and migrate commands to ensure models are valid and database tables are created as expected.

subtasks.title: Document Data Model in Data_Model.md
subtasks.description: Create and populate Data_Model.md in the /docs directory, detailing the schema, entities, attributes, and relationships.
subtasks.details: Write clear documentation for each model, including field descriptions, data types, and relationships. Include the ERD diagram and explanations of key constraints and business rules. Ensure the document is organized and accessible for future reference.
subtasks.testStrategy: Review the documentation for completeness and clarity. Have a team member unfamiliar with the schema validate that the document is understandable.

subtasks.title: Review and Refine Data Model
subtasks.description: Conduct a peer review of the data model and documentation, making adjustments based on feedback and ensuring alignment with PRD requirements.
subtasks.details: Share the Data_Model.md and Django models with relevant stakeholders for feedback. Address any issues related to normalization, naming conventions, or missing requirements. Update models and documentation as needed to finalize the data model.
subtasks.testStrategy: Confirm that all PRD requirements are met, and that the schema is normalized, consistent, and ready for implementation.

tasks.title: Implement User Management
tasks.description: Develop role-based registration and login for Citizens, Volunteers, and Authorities.
tasks.details: Extend Django User model or use custom user model with role field. Implement registration and login views. Use Django authentication and session management. Add role-based access control (RBAC) for secure access.
tasks.testStrategy: Test user registration, login, and role-based access. Verify unauthorized access is blocked.

subtasks.title: Design and Implement Custom User Model with Role Field
subtasks.description: Create a custom user model that extends Django's AbstractUser or AbstractBaseUser, adding a 'role' field to distinguish between Citizens, Volunteers, and Authorities.
subtasks.details: Define the custom user model in your app's models.py, including a CharField or ChoiceField for the role. Update settings.py to set AUTH_USER_MODEL to your new model. Implement a custom user manager if using AbstractBaseUser. Run migrations to apply the new model.
subtasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests to verify user creation with different roles and ensure the role field is correctly set and validated.

subtasks.title: Develop Registration Views and Forms for Each Role
subtasks.description: Implement registration views and forms that allow users to sign up as Citizens, Volunteers, or Authorities, ensuring the correct role is assigned during registration.
subtasks.details: Create separate registration forms or a unified form with role selection. In the registration view, handle form validation and save the user with the selected role. Ensure password hashing and user creation follow Django best practices.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test registration for each role, checking that users are created with the correct role and that invalid submissions are handled gracefully.

subtasks.title: Implement Login Functionality Using Django Authentication
subtasks.description: Set up login views and forms using Django's authentication system, allowing users of any role to log in securely.
subtasks.details: Use Django's built-in authentication views or create custom ones as needed. Ensure session management is enabled and users are authenticated based on email/username and password. Redirect users appropriately after login.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test login with valid and invalid credentials for each role, and verify session creation and user redirection.

subtasks.title: Configure Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
subtasks.description: Implement role-based access control to restrict or allow access to views and actions based on the user's role.
subtasks.details: Create custom decorators or mixins to check user roles before granting access to specific views. Apply these checks to views that require role-based restrictions. Document which roles have access to which resources.
subtasks.testStrategy: Write tests to ensure users with different roles can only access permitted views and are denied access otherwise.

subtasks.title: Integrate and Test End-to-End User Management Workflow
subtasks.description: Perform integration testing of the entire user management system, from registration to login and role-based access, ensuring all components work together seamlessly.
subtasks.details: Test the full workflow for each role: registration, login, and access to protected resources. Fix any integration issues and ensure user experience is consistent and secure.
subtasks.testStrategy: Automate end-to-end tests covering all user scenarios, including edge cases and security checks.

tasks.title: Develop Disaster Reporting
tasks.description: Enable Citizens to report disaster events with type, GPS, severity, and timestamp.
tasks.details: Create DisasterReport model and form. Implement a view for Citizens to submit reports. Store data in SQLite. Use Django admin for initial data management if needed.
tasks.testStrategy: Test report submission, data validation, and storage. Verify reports appear in admin and database.

subtasks.title: Design and Implement DisasterReport Model
subtasks.description: Create a Django model named DisasterReport to store disaster event details including type, GPS coordinates, severity, and timestamp.
subtasks.details: Define the DisasterReport model in models.py with fields: disaster_type (CharField or ChoiceField), latitude (FloatField), longitude (FloatField), severity (IntegerField or ChoiceField), and timestamp (DateTimeField, auto_now_add=True). Run migrations to create the table in SQLite.
subtasks.testStrategy: Use Django shell or admin to create and retrieve DisasterReport instances, verifying all fields are stored and retrieved correctly.

subtasks.title: Create Disaster Report Submission Form
subtasks.description: Develop a Django form for citizens to submit disaster reports, capturing all required fields.
subtasks.details: Implement a ModelForm for DisasterReport in forms.py, ensuring all fields are present and include validation for GPS coordinates and severity. Customize widgets for better user experience if needed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Render the form in a test view and submit sample data, checking for validation errors and correct data binding.

subtasks.title: Develop Disaster Report Submission View and Template
subtasks.description: Implement a Django view and corresponding template to allow citizens to submit disaster reports via the form.
subtasks.details: Create a class-based or function-based view to handle GET (display form) and POST (process submission) requests. On successful submission, save the report to the database and provide user feedback. Design a user-friendly HTML template for the form.
subtasks.testStrategy: Manually test the view by submitting reports through the browser, verifying successful submissions and error handling.

subtasks.title: Integrate DisasterReport with Django Admin
subtasks.description: Register the DisasterReport model with Django admin to enable initial data management and review by administrators.
subtasks.details: In admin.py, register the DisasterReport model and customize the admin interface to display key fields (type, severity, timestamp, GPS). Optionally, add search and filter capabilities for efficient management.
subtasks.testStrategy: Access the Django admin panel, create, edit, and delete DisasterReport entries, and verify that all fields are displayed and managed correctly.

subtasks.title: Test End-to-End Disaster Reporting Workflow
subtasks.description: Verify the complete workflow from citizen report submission to data storage and admin review.
subtasks.details: Perform end-to-end testing by submitting disaster reports through the form, ensuring data is saved in SQLite and visible in the admin interface. Check for data integrity and usability.
subtasks.testStrategy: Submit multiple reports with varying data, confirm their presence and accuracy in the admin panel, and ensure no errors occur throughout the process.

tasks.title: Implement Aid Request Management
tasks.description: Allow Citizens to submit aid requests (food, shelter, rescue).
tasks.details: Create AidRequest model and form. Implement view for Citizens to request aid. Link to DisasterReport if needed. Store in SQLite.
tasks.testStrategy: Test aid request submission, validation, and storage. Verify requests appear in admin and database.

subtasks.title: Design AidRequest Model
subtasks.description: Define the AidRequest data model to capture aid type (food, shelter, rescue), citizen details, status, and optional link to DisasterReport.
subtasks.details: Create a new model (e.g., AidRequest) with fields for request type, description, citizen reference, status, timestamp, and a foreign key to DisasterReport (nullable). Ensure the model supports all required data for aid requests.
subtasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests to verify model field constraints, relationships, and database migrations.

subtasks.title: Implement Aid Request Submission Form
subtasks.description: Develop a form for citizens to submit aid requests, capturing all necessary information and validating input.
subtasks.details: Create a form (using Django Forms, React, or relevant framework) that maps to the AidRequest model. Include fields for aid type, description, and disaster report selection (if applicable). Add validation for required fields and input formats.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test form rendering, validation errors, and successful data capture in isolation.

subtasks.title: Develop Aid Request Submission View
subtasks.description: Create a view/controller to handle displaying the aid request form, processing submissions, and saving valid requests to the database.
subtasks.details: Implement a view (e.g., Django view, Express route) that renders the form, handles POST submissions, validates data, and creates AidRequest records. Redirect or display confirmation on success; show errors on failure.
subtasks.testStrategy: Write integration tests for GET and POST requests, checking correct database updates and error handling.

subtasks.title: Integrate Aid Request with DisasterReport Linking
subtasks.description: Enable citizens to optionally link their aid request to an existing DisasterReport, ensuring referential integrity.
subtasks.details: Update the form and view logic to allow selection of a DisasterReport (if relevant). Ensure the AidRequest model's foreign key is set correctly and that only valid DisasterReports can be linked.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test aid requests with and without DisasterReport links, verifying correct associations in the database.

subtasks.title: Persist Aid Requests in SQLite and Verify Data Flow
subtasks.description: Ensure all aid requests are stored in the SQLite database and verify end-to-end data flow from submission to storage.
subtasks.details: Configure the application to use SQLite for persistence. Test that new aid requests are correctly saved and retrievable. Check database schema and data integrity.
subtasks.testStrategy: Perform end-to-end tests: submit aid requests via the UI, then query the database to confirm correct storage and associations.

tasks.title: Develop Volunteer Coordination
tasks.description: Enable Volunteers to register skills/availability and Authorities to assign tasks.
tasks.details: Create Volunteer model with skills and availability fields. Implement views for Volunteers to register and Authorities to assign tasks. Use Django admin for initial management.
tasks.testStrategy: Test volunteer registration, skill/availability updates, and task assignment. Verify data integrity.

subtasks.title: Design and Implement Volunteer Model
subtasks.description: Create a Django model for Volunteers that includes fields for personal information, skills, and availability.
subtasks.details: Define the Volunteer model in models.py with fields such as name, contact info, a ManyToManyField or CharField for skills, and a suitable field (e.g., JSONField, DateTimeField, or custom structure) for availability. Apply migrations to create the database table.
subtasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests to verify model creation, field validation, and correct storage of skills and availability.

subtasks.title: Develop Volunteer Registration View and Form
subtasks.description: Implement a view and form to allow volunteers to register, including entering their skills and availability.
subtasks.details: Create a Django form for the Volunteer model, exposing fields for skills and availability. Implement a registration view (class-based or function-based) to handle GET and POST requests, saving valid submissions to the database. Add templates for user-friendly input.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test form validation, successful registration, and error handling through automated and manual tests.

subtasks.title: Create Authority Task Assignment Model
subtasks.description: Design and implement a model for tasks that can be assigned to volunteers by authorities.
subtasks.details: Define a Task model with fields such as title, description, required skills, scheduled time, and a ForeignKey or ManyToManyField to Volunteers. Ensure tasks can be linked to both authorities and volunteers.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test model relationships and ensure tasks can be created and associated with volunteers.

subtasks.title: Implement Authority Task Assignment View
subtasks.description: Develop a view for authorities to assign tasks to volunteers based on their skills and availability.
subtasks.details: Create a view that lists available volunteers filtered by required skills and availability for a given task. Allow authorities to select volunteers and assign them to tasks. Provide feedback on successful assignments.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test assignment logic, filtering accuracy, and correct database updates after assignments.

subtasks.title: Configure Django Admin for Volunteer and Task Management
subtasks.description: Set up Django admin interfaces for managing volunteers and tasks, enabling initial data entry and oversight.
subtasks.details: Register the Volunteer and Task models with the Django admin site. Customize admin views to display relevant fields, enable search/filtering, and support bulk actions if needed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that admin users can add, edit, and delete volunteers and tasks, and that all fields are displayed and editable as intended.

tasks.title: Build Shelter Directory
tasks.description: Display a public list of shelters with location, capacity, and availability.
tasks.details: Create Shelter model. Implement a public view to list shelters. Allow filtering by location and availability. Use Bootstrap for responsive UI.
tasks.testStrategy: Test shelter listing, filtering, and UI responsiveness. Verify data accuracy.

subtasks.title: Design and Implement Shelter Data Model
subtasks.description: Create the Shelter model with fields for location, capacity, and availability to store shelter information in the database.
subtasks.details: Define the Shelter model in the backend, ensuring fields for location (address or coordinates), capacity (total and current), and availability (boolean or calculated). Apply necessary validations and database migrations.
subtasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests to verify model field constraints and correct data storage.

subtasks.title: Seed and Manage Shelter Data
subtasks.description: Populate the database with sample shelter data and implement basic CRUD operations for shelters.
subtasks.details: Create scripts or admin interfaces to add, update, and remove shelter records. Ensure data includes varied locations, capacities, and availability statuses for testing.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify data can be created, read, updated, and deleted through the admin interface or scripts.

subtasks.title: Develop Public Shelter Directory View
subtasks.description: Implement a public-facing page that lists all shelters with their location, capacity, and availability.
subtasks.details: Build a responsive frontend view using Bootstrap to display shelter data in a clear, accessible format. Ensure all required fields are visible and the layout adapts to different devices.
subtasks.testStrategy: Manually verify the directory displays correct data and is responsive on various screen sizes.

subtasks.title: Implement Filtering by Location and Availability
subtasks.description: Add filtering controls to the shelter directory to allow users to filter shelters by location and availability.
subtasks.details: Integrate frontend filter controls (e.g., dropdowns, search boxes) and backend query logic to filter shelters based on user input. Ensure filters update the displayed list dynamically.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test filtering functionality with different combinations of location and availability to ensure accurate results.

subtasks.title: Enhance UI with Bootstrap and Accessibility Features
subtasks.description: Refine the shelter directory UI using Bootstrap components and ensure accessibility best practices are followed.
subtasks.details: Apply Bootstrap styling for tables, forms, and layout. Add ARIA labels and keyboard navigation support to improve accessibility for all users.
subtasks.testStrategy: Conduct accessibility audits and cross-browser testing to confirm usability and compliance.

tasks.title: Design UI/UX and Navigation Flow
tasks.description: Create mockups and structural descriptions for base template and key pages. Diagram navigation flow.
tasks.details: Create UI_UX_Design.md and Navigation_Flow.md in /docs. Use Bootstrap for UI consistency. Diagram user journeys for Citizens, Volunteers, Authorities.
tasks.testStrategy: Review mockups and diagrams for completeness and alignment with PRD. Validate navigation logic.

subtasks.title: Define User Roles and Key Page Requirements
subtasks.description: Identify and document the primary user roles (Citizens, Volunteers, Authorities) and the essential pages and features each requires. Clarify the goals and needs for each user type to inform UI/UX decisions.
subtasks.details: Conduct brief stakeholder interviews or review project documentation to list user roles and their core tasks. Summarize these in the initial section of UI_UX_Design.md for reference throughout the design process.
subtasks.testStrategy: Review with stakeholders to confirm all user roles and key requirements are accurately captured.

subtasks.title: Draft Wireframes for Base Template and Key Pages
subtasks.description: Create low-fidelity wireframes for the base layout and all major pages, ensuring coverage of core user journeys for each role.
subtasks.details: Use a wireframing tool or hand sketches to outline the structure of each page. Focus on layout, navigation elements, and placement of primary actions. Save wireframes as images and embed or link them in UI_UX_Design.md.
subtasks.testStrategy: Validate wireframes with team members for completeness and logical flow before proceeding to visual design.

subtasks.title: Design High-Fidelity Mockups Using Bootstrap
subtasks.description: Transform wireframes into detailed, visually consistent mockups using Bootstrap components and design guidelines.
subtasks.details: Leverage Bootstrap’s UI kit to ensure consistency in buttons, forms, navigation bars, and other elements. Create mockups for each key page and the base template. Include screenshots or design files in UI_UX_Design.md.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check mockups for adherence to Bootstrap standards and accessibility guidelines. Solicit feedback from stakeholders.

subtasks.title: Diagram Navigation Flow and User Journeys
subtasks.description: Map out the navigation structure and user journeys for Citizens, Volunteers, and Authorities, illustrating how users move between pages.
subtasks.details: Use a diagramming tool to create flowcharts showing navigation paths and decision points for each user type. Save diagrams as images and include them in Navigation_Flow.md.
subtasks.testStrategy: Walk through each user journey using the diagrams to ensure all scenarios are covered and navigation is intuitive.

subtasks.title: Document UI/UX Design and Navigation Flow
subtasks.description: Compile all wireframes, mockups, and navigation diagrams into UI_UX_Design.md and Navigation_Flow.md within the /docs directory, providing clear explanations and rationale.
subtasks.details: Organize documentation with sections for user roles, wireframes, mockups, and navigation diagrams. Add concise descriptions and design rationale for each artifact. Ensure both markdown files are clear and accessible for future reference.
subtasks.testStrategy: Review documentation for completeness, clarity, and usability. Confirm all required artifacts are present and well-explained.

tasks.title: Implement Administrative Dashboard
tasks.description: Enable Authorities to manage users, reports, shelters, and assignments.
tasks.details: Create a dashboard view for Authorities. Display aggregated data and management controls. Use Django admin as a base and extend with custom views if needed.
tasks.testStrategy: Test dashboard access, data aggregation, and management features. Verify role-based access.

subtasks.title: Set Up Base Django Admin for Core Models
subtasks.description: Register the User, Report, Shelter, and Assignment models with the Django admin site to enable basic CRUD operations for authorities.
subtasks.details: Use Django's admin.site.register for each relevant model. Ensure that all necessary fields are visible and editable. Confirm that authorities can access the admin interface and see the registered models.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that each model appears in the admin dashboard and that records can be created, viewed, updated, and deleted.

subtasks.title: Customize List and Detail Views for Management
subtasks.description: Enhance the admin interface for each model by customizing list displays, filters, search fields, and detail layouts to streamline management tasks.
subtasks.details: Use ModelAdmin options such as list_display, list_filter, search_fields, and fieldsets to tailor the admin views. Add inline editing for related models where appropriate. Group and order fields for clarity.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that authorities can efficiently search, filter, and manage records, and that the interface displays relevant information for each model.

subtasks.title: Implement Aggregated Data and Dashboard Overview
subtasks.description: Create a custom dashboard view that displays aggregated statistics (e.g., user counts, report statuses, shelter occupancy) for authorities.
subtasks.details: Develop a custom admin view or dashboard page using Django admin's template override or a custom admin view. Aggregate data from the models and present it using charts, tables, or summary cards.
subtasks.testStrategy: Validate that the dashboard accurately displays up-to-date aggregated data and is accessible from the admin interface.

subtasks.title: Add Custom Management Actions and Bulk Operations
subtasks.description: Extend the admin with custom actions for bulk management, such as assigning users to shelters, updating report statuses, or exporting data.
subtasks.details: Define custom ModelAdmin actions and integrate them into the admin list views. Ensure actions are contextually appropriate and provide feedback to the user upon completion.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test each custom action for correct functionality, including edge cases and error handling. Confirm that bulk operations update the database as expected.

subtasks.title: Enhance Admin Interface with Styling and Usability Improvements
subtasks.description: Improve the visual appearance and usability of the admin dashboard through template overrides, custom CSS, and third-party packages if needed.
subtasks.details: Override Django admin templates to adjust layout and branding. Apply custom CSS for better readability and navigation. Optionally, use packages like django-admin-interface for advanced theming.
subtasks.testStrategy: Review the admin dashboard for visual consistency, accessibility, and ease of use. Solicit feedback from authority users and iterate as needed.

tasks.title: Integrate Real-time Updates
tasks.description: Incorporate real-time updates for disaster reports and shelter availability.
tasks.details: Use Django Channels or similar for real-time features. Implement WebSocket or polling for updates. Update UI dynamically for relevant users.
tasks.testStrategy: Test real-time notification and UI updates. Verify data consistency and performance.

subtasks.title: Set Up Django Channels and ASGI Configuration
subtasks.description: Install Django Channels and configure the ASGI application to enable WebSocket support for real-time features.
subtasks.details: Add 'channels' and 'daphne' to INSTALLED_APPS in settings.py. Set ASGI_APPLICATION to your project's ASGI entry point. Configure CHANNEL_LAYERS using Redis or another backend for message routing. Ensure daphne is used as the ASGI server.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that the server starts without errors and that the ASGI application is correctly recognized.

subtasks.title: Implement WebSocket Consumers for Real-Time Data
subtasks.description: Create Django Channels consumers to handle WebSocket connections for disaster reports and shelter availability updates.
subtasks.details: Define consumers in consumers.py to manage WebSocket events (connect, receive, disconnect). Set up routing for WebSocket URLs. Ensure consumers can broadcast updates to relevant groups or users.
subtasks.testStrategy: Use WebSocket testing tools or browser dev tools to connect and receive messages from the consumer endpoints.

subtasks.title: Integrate Real-Time Data Serialization and Broadcasting
subtasks.description: Serialize disaster report and shelter data and broadcast updates to connected clients via WebSockets.
subtasks.details: Use Django Rest Framework serializers to format data as JSON. In consumers, serialize updated data and send it to clients when changes occur. Trigger broadcasts on model changes or via signals.
subtasks.testStrategy: Trigger data changes in the backend and confirm that serialized updates are received by connected clients in real time.

subtasks.title: Update Frontend to Handle Real-Time Updates
subtasks.description: Modify the frontend to establish WebSocket connections and dynamically update the UI when new data is received.
subtasks.details: Implement JavaScript logic to connect to the WebSocket endpoint, listen for incoming messages, and update disaster reports and shelter availability in the UI without page reloads.
subtasks.testStrategy: Simulate backend updates and verify that the frontend reflects changes instantly and accurately.

subtasks.title: Implement Fallback Polling Mechanism
subtasks.description: Provide a fallback mechanism using periodic polling for clients that do not support WebSockets.
subtasks.details: Add JavaScript logic to periodically fetch updates via HTTP requests if WebSocket connection fails or is unsupported. Ensure the UI updates similarly to the WebSocket approach.
subtasks.testStrategy: Disable WebSocket support in the browser and confirm that polling retrieves and displays updates as expected.
